>So said rahuls_25 on 2003-08-07 --------------------
>Hi,
>I am a newbie t=
o JUnit and my company uses automatic build to run 
>test cases written in =
Junit for each java class. But, we are not 
>testing EJBs currently as it w=
ould involve creating .ear file and 
>testing. So, can anybody tell me what=
 is the best way to test Entity, 
>session and message beans and servlets? =
Is there anyway to test JSPs?
>Any samples/links provided will be much appr=
eciated.

My coauthor and I will devote approximately 100 pages to this in =
our upcoming book. Please understand that we can't do it by tomorrow. :)

S=
ince you are testing code already written, my strong suggestion is to start=
 by testing through the end-user interface or using a package like Cactus. =
Thorough and fast testing of EJBs requires a certain design approach that n=
ot many people take.

Take care.
